author: Anthony Gharib
title: NFL Week 17 uniforms: Cowboys' navy look, Ravens rock purple pants - ESPN
text: Traditional uniforms dominate Week 17 of the 2023 NFL season as the calendar year comes to a close. The [Dallas Cowboys](/nfl/team/_/name/dal/dallas-cowboys) will wear their navy threads against the [Detroit Lions](/nfl/team/_/name/det/detroit-lions) in a Saturday night matchup. The [Arizona Cardinals](/nfl/team/_/name/ari/arizona-cardinals) are going all white, while the [Jacksonville Jaguars](/nfl/team/_/name/jax/jacksonville-jaguars) break out their teal jerseys for the second time this month. The [Miami Dolphins](/nfl/team/_/name/mia/miami-dolphins) and [Baltimore Ravens](/nfl/team/_/name/bal/baltimore-ravens) have arguably the top uniform matchup of the weekend. Here are the uniforms for all NFL teams in action Saturday, Sunday and Monday: [Arizona Cardinals](/nfl/team/_/name/ari/arizona-cardinals) Helmet: White Jersey: White Pants: White kicking off NYE right ‚ú®‚Äî Arizona Cardinals (@AZCardinals) [pic.twitter.com/wscNjIq1fq] [December 27, 2023] [Atlanta Falcons](/nfl/team/_/name/atl/atlanta-falcons) Helmet: Black Jersey: White Pants: Black NYE fit üéä‚Äî Atlanta Falcons (@AtlantaFalcons) [December 28, 2023] [Baltimore Ravens](/nfl/team/_/name/bal/baltimore-ravens) Helmet: Black Jersey: Black Pants: Purple It's time üòà‚Äî Baltimore Ravens (@Ravens) [@Invisalign] [pic.twitter.com/cvlJJwrXuv] [December 28, 2023] [Buffalo Bills](/nfl/team/_/name/buf/buffalo-bills) Helmet: White Jersey: Blue Pants: White Our New Year's Eve look. üòç‚Äî Buffalo Bills (@BuffaloBills) [#NEvsBUF]| [#BillsMafia] [pic.twitter.com/Tbupa61oXR] [December 28, 2023] [Carolina Panthers](/nfl/team/_/name/car/carolina-panthers) Helmet: Silver Jersey: White Pants: TBA [Chicago Bears](/nfl/team/_/name/chi/chicago-bears) Helmet: Navy blue Jersey: Navy blue Pants: TBA [Cincinnati Bengals](/nfl/team/_/name/cin/cincinnati-bengals) Helmet: Orange Jersey: White Pants: White Our Kansas City look.‚Äî Cincinnati Bengals (@Bengals) [pic.twitter.com/YbBvrZtVTh] [December 27, 2023] [Dallas Cowboys](/nfl/team/_/name/dal/dallas-cowboys) Helmet: Silver Jersey: Navy blue Pants: White [Denver Broncos](/nfl/team/_/name/den/denver-broncos) Helmet: Navy blue Jersey: Orange Pants: White [Detroit Lions](/nfl/team/_/name/det/detroit-lions) Helmet: Silver Jersey: White Pants: White Last‚Äî Detroit Lions (@Lions) [#Lions]gameday of 2023! author: CNN Newsource
title: Cruise ship rescues 68 migrants drifting off Spain‚Äôs Canary Islands
text: By Sharon Braithwaite, CNN (CNN) ‚Äî A luxury cruise ship rescued 68 migrants drifting off the Spanish Canary Islands on Wednesday, Spain‚Äôs maritime rescue agency said in a statement on X. The bulk carrier Philipp Oldendorff spotted a canoe-shaped boat adrift with people on board roughly 440 nautical miles, or about 815 km, south of Tenerife, and provided first aid to those affected while passenger ship Insignia was sent to the area, the Salvamento Maritimo statement said. The Insignia, owned by Oceania Cruises, rescued a total of 68 people and recovered three bodies, the agency said, adding that it could not recover the remains of two people due to poor weather conditions. On Thursday, Insignia‚Äôs crew reported that one of the rescued migrants was in critical condition and needed to be evacuated. He died before a search and rescue helicopter could reach him, the agency said. The 62 men, three women and three minors rescued were from sub-Sahara Africa, according to the Insignia‚Äôs report to the agency. ‚ÄúSafety of life at sea is of paramount importance for all seafarers,‚Äù an Oceania Cruises spokesperson told CNN via email. ‚ÄúWe can confirm that Insignia rescued 68 people from a vessel in distress between Cape Verde and Tenerife and bought them onboard for medical assistance and provided food, drinks, clothing and a safe place to rest. We have coordinated next steps with authorities in Tenerife, and they will be taking over the care of the rescued people,‚Äù the spokesperson added. The 670-guest Insignia is currently sailing its 180-day Around-The-World cruise. Data from Spain‚Äôs Interior ministry show a drastic increase of the number of migrants arriving by sea, especially to the Canary Islands. According to Spain‚Äôs Interior ministry, between January 1 and June 15, 23,037 migrants have arrived in Spain by sea, a 122.6% increase compared to the same period last year. Of those, 18,977 have arrived to the Canary Islands by sea ‚Äî an increase of 220.9% compared to the same period last year. Earlier this month Spanish NGO Caminando Fronteras said that at least 5,000 migrants have died trying to reach Spain this year between January and May, an average of 33 people per day. The-CNN-Wire ‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Noticias SIN
title: Muere gimnasta Natalie Stichova mientras trataba de hacerse un ‚Äúselfie‚Äù en una monta√±a
text:
Alemania.- La gimnasta checa Natalie Stichova, de 23 a√±os, muri√≥ tr√°gicamente en un accidente mientras intentaba hacerse un ‚Äúselfie‚Äù en una monta√±a de 80 metros de altura en Baviera, Alemania. El incidente ocurri√≥ el 15 de agosto, pero la terrible noticia has trascendido ahora.
Natalie Stichova estaba visitando el Castillo de Neuschwanstein, situado en la monta√±a Tegelberg, con su familia. En un intento por capturar el momento realizando una de sus acrobacias, la joven perdi√≥ el equilibrio y cay√≥ al vac√≠o. Aunque los servicios de emergencia la rescataron con vida, las graves lesiones cerebrales que sufri√≥ resultaron ser irreversibles, y su fallecimiento se confirm√≥ el martes 27 de agosto.
El club Sokol Pribram Sports Gymnastics, donde Stichova entrenaba, ha emitido un comunicado lamentando profundamente la p√©rdida de la gimnasta. ¬´Natalie reparti√≥ sonrisas a lo largo de su corta vida y as√≠ la recordaremos por siempre. Extendemos nuestro m√°s sentido p√©same a su familia y amigos cercanos, envi√°ndoles fuerza y apoyo en estos momentos tan dif√≠ciles¬ª, se√±ala el comunicado.
La madre de Natalie, profundamente afectada por la tragedia, expres√≥ su dolor en las redes sociales con un emotivo mensaje: ¬´Ella era incre√≠ble, todos la quer√≠amos mucho y nunca dejaremos de quererla. Estoy orgullosa de que fueras mi hija, la ni√±a de mis sue√±os. Me ense√±aste tanto. Ojal√° pudieras ense√±arme m√°s¬ª.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Bend Police update: Missing Arizona woman has been found uninjured
text:
By Barney Lerten ,
1 day ago Bend Police Dept. Julie CollinsNegrelli Bend Police Dept. Julie Negrelli, in outfit she last was seen wearing, police say. (Update: Police say missing woman has been found uninjured)
BEND, Ore. (KTVZ) ‚Äì A few hours after Bend Police requested the public‚Äôs help in finding a missing Arizona woman, officers found the woman uninjured late Wednesday afternoon.
Police located Julie Collins Negrelli, 42, of Flagstaff, Arizona, in Bend around 4 p.m. and "she is uninjured," Bend Police Communications Manager Sheila Miller said.
"Thank you to the public for your assistance in this investigation," Miller added.
Earlier info:
who went for a walk Monday night from the Campfire Hotel and a few hours later told her boyfriend she was helping get a homeless person something to eat at a convenience store.
Officers responded around 7:30 p.m. Tuesday to a report of a missing person at the hotel in the 700 block of NE Third Street, Bend Police Communications Manager Sheila Miller said Wednesday in a news release.
The caller said his girlfriend, Julie Collins Negrelli, 42, of Flagstaff, Arizona went for a walk around 9:30 p.m. on Monday, taking only her phone and room key, and failed to return.
He told police he last spoke to Negrelli around 1:25 a.m. Tuesday, when she told him she was at a convenience store, helping a homeless person get something to eat, Miller said. She said she planned to return to the hotel when she was done, but her boyfriend has not heard from her since.
Negrelli was visiting Central Oregon with her boyfriend to go rock-climbing, Miller said, and is not familiar with the area.
Officers conducted an extensive search for Negrelli overnight but did not find her, Miller said, adding that the search is ongoing.
Negrelli is described as a white female, with blue eyes and brown hair. She‚Äôs about 5-feet-2 and weighs about 115 pounds. Her nose is pierced on both sides and she has a small cross tattoo on her sternum. Miller said she last was seen wearing a gray hoodie sweatshirt that says ‚ÄúOne Eyed Buffalo‚Äù and black leggings.
If you see Negrelli, you‚Äôre asked to call Deschutes County non-emergency dispatch at 541-693-6911.
The post Bend Police update: Missing Arizona woman has been found uninjured appeared first on KTVZ .

author: Chris Clow
title: Congressman touts bipartisan long-term care bill at DC event
text:
A bill that would establish a long-term care (LTC) insurance plan at the federal level has been reintroduced in the House of Representatives . Its chief sponsor has received bipartisan support and is hitting the road to communicate its potential benefits to constituents.
Last month, Rep. Tom Suozzi (D-N.Y.) reintroduced the Well-Being Insurance for Seniors to be at Home (WISH) Act, which would amend Social Security to provide long-term care benefits for program participants. The bill‚Äôs co-sponsor is Rep. John Moolenaar (R-Mich.).
In an effort to get the word out, Suozzi held an event in Washington, D.C. , earlier this month to describe the plan to constituents.
The event included ‚Äúover 100 healthcare experts, insurers, elder advocates, caregiver organizations and policymakers from across the aisle to address America‚Äôs looming long-term care crisis,‚Äù Suozzi‚Äôs office said.
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a storm coming,‚Äù Suozzi explained in a prepared statement. ‚ÄúEvery day, 10,000 Americans turn 65, and in five years, 6,500 Americans will reach 80 every single day.
‚ÄúOur nursing homes and Medicaid system cannot deal with this. We don‚Äôt have enough nursing home beds, we can‚Äôt afford it, and seniors would prefer to age at home .‚Äù
The act would seek to create a new public-private partnership between the federal government and the insurance industry, according to the text of the bill . It would establish ‚Äúa monthly federal benefit for Americans who become disabled in old age, after a 1- to 5-year elimination period based on income,‚Äù Suozzi‚Äôs office said.
Within that period, potential beneficiaries would be required to rely on private insurance programs or ‚Äúpersonal resources‚Äù with a two-pronged goal: to provide coverage for those with the greatest determined need, and to ‚Äúcreate new incentives for private insurers to offer affordable long-term care products.‚Äù
The legislation would ‚Äúestablish a federal catastrophic long-term care insurance program, designed to help disabled seniors age with dignity in their own homes ‚Äî while reinvigorating the private long-term care insurance market,‚Äù Suozzi‚Äôs office said.
So far, Suozzi and Moolenaar are the only sponsors in the House. But Moolenaar described what led to his support for the measure.
‚ÄúWhat I like about the WISH Act is that it really tries to engage a lot of stakeholders,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúTo me, that‚Äôs a win-win because we want to make sure our seniors are getting the best care possible. We want to make sure people don‚Äôt have to choose between poverty and losing all their life savings and they can‚Äôt qualify for different care.
‚ÄúWe want to make sure that individuals who don‚Äôt have families who can take care of them have a place and can be provided for,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThis really is common sense, it‚Äôs bipartisan, it‚Äôs something that encourages people to do the right thing.‚Äù
According to Suozzi‚Äôs office, the organizations that have voiced support for the bill thus far include the National Council on Aging , the American College of Physicians , American Geriatrics Society , the National Alliance for Caregiving and Genworth Financial .
Suozzi previously introduced a version of the WISH Act in mid-2021, but the bill never garnered a co-sponsor and did not progress beyond committee referrals during that session.

author: @worldbank
title: El Grupo Banco Mundial se propone ampliar los servicios de salud a 1500 millones de personas
text: Se busca lograr mayor asequibilidad y ampliar la cobertura geogr√°fica y el alcance de los servicios CIUDAD DE WASHINGTON, 18 de abril de 2024. El Grupo Banco Mundial anunci√≥ hoy un ambicioso plan para ayudar a los pa√≠ses a brindar servicios de salud asequibles y de calidad a 1500 millones de personas para 2030. Esto forma parte de un esfuerzo global m√°s amplio dirigido a ofrecer un est√°ndar b√°sico de atenci√≥n en todas las etapas de la vida: infancia, ni√±ez, adolescencia y adultez. Durante d√©cadas, el Grupo Banco Mundial ha contribuido a proporcionar servicios de salud a mujeres y ni√±os en m√°s de 100 pa√≠ses. Ahora, gracias a un esfuerzo particularmente orientado a lograr mayor rapidez, trabajar mejor con los asociados y atraer al sector privado, esta instituci√≥n de 80 a√±os de antig√ºedad puede buscar mayor escala y mayor impacto. La estrategia que se aplicar√° para llegar a 1500 millones de personas se basa en tres elementos fundamentales: - Ampliar el foco m√°s all√° de la salud maternoinfantil para brindar cobertura a lo largo de toda la vida de una persona e incluir tambi√©n las enfermedades no transmisibles. - Extender las operaciones hacia zonas de dif√≠cil acceso, como aldeas, ciudades y pa√≠ses remotos. - Trabajar con los Gobiernos para reducir los aranceles innecesarios y otros obst√°culos financieros a la atenci√≥n de la salud. Para alcanzar este objetivo, se contabilizar√°n √∫nicamente las personas que hayan sido atendidas y tratadas por un trabajador de la salud a trav√©s de una visita presencial o una teleconsulta. ‚ÄúProporcionar a las personas un est√°ndar b√°sico de atenci√≥n durante toda su vida es fundamental para el desarrollo‚Äù, dijo Ajay Banga, presidente del Grupo Banco Mundial. ‚ÄúEsta aspiraci√≥n no podr√° hacerse realidad con un esfuerzo individual. Se necesitar√°n socios, una coalici√≥n de los sectores p√∫blico y privado que trabaje en conjunto para ampliar el acceso a los servicios de atenci√≥n de la salud‚Äù. En la actualidad, unos 2000 millones de personas enfrentan graves dificultades financieras cuando deben pagar servicios de salud. Una serie de desaf√≠os interrelacionados, como el cambio clim√°tico, las pandemias, los conflictos, el envejecimiento de la sociedad y un d√©ficit proyectado de 10 millones de trabajadores de la salud para 2030 exacerban el ciclo de la pobreza y la desigualdad. El Grupo Banco Mundial combinar√° financiamiento, conocimientos y alianzas para abordar este desaf√≠o. Y podr√° hacer uso de todos los elementos que conforman su capacidad financiera en funci√≥n de las necesidades y de la etapa de desarrollo espec√≠ficas de cada pa√≠s para llegar a 1500 millones de personas. En el caso de los pa√≠ses m√°s necesitados, la ayuda financiera de la Asociaci√≥n Internacional de Fomento permitir√° llevar trabajadores de la salud a comunidades que de otro modo no tendr√≠an acceso a los servicios. En los pa√≠ses de ingreso mediano, el Banco Internacional de Reconstrucci√≥n y Fomento suministrar√° financiamiento para incentivar las inversiones p√∫blicas en salud y la promulgaci√≥n de normas que favorezcan los avances. Con certidumbre regulatoria y una gesti√≥n institucional confiable, se abre la puerta a un mayor volumen de inversiones del sector privado, en especial en la producci√≥n local de medicamentos y equipos de protecci√≥n. Ser√° fundamental que el Grupo del Banco Mundial establezca alianzas s√≥lidas para lograr resultados en el √°rea de la salud, puesto que no alcanzar√° su objetivo si no trabaja codo a codo ‚Äîm√°s r√°pido y mejor‚Äî con las organizaciones no gubernamentales, el sector privado y la sociedad civil. El Grupo Banco Mundial celebra el anuncio de que Jap√≥n pondr√° en marcha un Centro de Conocimientos sobre la Cobertura Universal de Salud dirigido a mejorar la capacidad de los ministerios de Salud y Finanzas, iniciativa que cuenta con el apoyo del Banco y de la Organizaci√≥n Mundial de la Salud. El objetivo de brindar servicios de salud asequibles y de calidad a 1500 millones de personas para 2030 es uno de los ejemplos m√°s recientes del compromiso del Grupo Banco Mundial de orientarse m√°s a lograr impacto y el subproducto de un esfuerzo concertado por construir un Banco mejor. Para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n, visite [https://www.bancomundial.org/es/topic/health/overview](https://www.bancomundial.org/es/topic/health/overview) y s√≠ganos en [www.twitter.com/WBG_Health](http://www.twitter.com/WBG_Health)
